org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report

Class Report

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.ReportItem
      • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.PGroup
        • org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.Report

  • public class Report
extends PGroup
    The centerpiece of this package. ReportItems are added to a Report, and then the Report is printed. A Report instance generally corresponds to a single PDF file, although multiple Reports can print to a single PDF.

    The following example illustrates a straightforward use of Report: 

       SimplePDF pdf=new SimplePDF(myOutputStream);
   Report report=new Report(pdf);
   //... Add items to the report
   report.printAndClose(pdf);

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.tmotte.pdfrpt.report.PGroup

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Report(float pageWidth, float pageHeight)
      Creates a new Report that uses the specified width and height for its pages.
      Report(PageInfo pageInfo)
      Shortcut to Report(pageInfo.getWidth(), pageInfo.getHeight()); here, Report will attempt to respect the margins set on pageInfo and provide positional information based on the space bounded by those margins, not the boundaries of the page itself.
      Report(SimplePDF pdf)
      Shortcut to Report(pdf.getPageInfo()).

      • Report

        public Report(float pageWidth,
      float pageHeight)
        Creates a new Report that uses the specified width and height for its pages.

      • Report

        public Report(PageInfo pageInfo)
        Shortcut to Report(pageInfo.getWidth(), pageInfo.getHeight()); here, Report will attempt to respect the margins set on pageInfo and provide positional information based on the space bounded by those margins, not the boundaries of the page itself.
        See Also:
        PageInfo.setMargins(float, float, float, float)

      • Report

        Shortcut to Report(pdf.getPageInfo()).

    • Method Detail

      • newPage

        public Report newPage()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Starts a new page in the PDF file, which will be created using SimplePDF.newPage()
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        SimplePDF.newPage()

      • addVerticalIfPageFits

        public boolean addVerticalIfPageFits(ReportItem item,
                            float footerHeight)
        Enhances PGroup.addVertical(ReportItem...) such that item is only added if it fits on the page vertically below the last ReportItem added, and with enough space left over for footerHeight.
        Returns:
        true if item fits, false if not.

      • addVerticalIfPageFits

        public boolean addVerticalIfPageFits(ReportItem item)
        A shortcut to addVerticalIfPageFits(item, 0)

      • addVertical

        public boolean addVertical(ReportItem item,
                  PageCount pageCount,
                  ReportItem footer,
                  ReportItem header)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        An enhancement over addVerticalIfPageFits() that lumps a variety of page-management features into a single method: If item fits within the remaining space on the page (including the space needed for footer) it is added via addVertical(ReportItem); if not, the following takes place:
             addFooter(footer);   //Add the footer to the current page:
     newPage();           //Start a new page
     pageCount.inc();     //Increment the page counter
     addVertical(header); //Add the header to the top of the new page.
        addVertical(item); //Now add the item as originally intended

        When using this method, the programmer is only responsible for adding a footer to the to the very last page of the Report.

        Parameters:
        item - The ReportItem to add.
        pageCount - (optional) A PageCount instance that should be incremented if we start a new page.
        footer - (optional) A ReportItem to be added as a footer to the current page if we must start a new page.
        header - (optional) A ReportItem to be added as a header to the next page if we must start a new page.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        footerPrintAndClose(SimplePDF, ReportItem)

      • addFooter

        public Report addFooter(ReportItem footer)
        Adds footer to the bottom of the current page, setting footer's top offset so it fits flush with the bottom page margin, i.e. footer.setTop(Report.getHeight()-footer.getHeight()). Note that the same footer instance can be added to every page, since it always receive the same height setting.

      • printAndClose

        public void printAndClose(SimplePDF pdf)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        A shortcut to Report.print() and pdf.close(). The PDF will be complete and no further action need be taken (closing OutputStreams, etc.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • footerPrintAndClose

        public void footerPrintAndClose(SimplePDF pdf,
                       ReportItem footer)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        A shortcut to addFooter(footer).printAndClose(pdf).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
